segment.source: This section provides step-by-step instructions for organizing your compatibility data in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM).
segment.target: This section provides step-by-step instructions for organizing your compatibility data in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM).

segment.source: This section provides step-by-step instructions for organizing your compatibility data in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM).
segment.target: This section provides step-by-step instructions for organizing your compatibility data in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM).

segment.source: Organizational Tasks for Each Report Type
segment.target: Organizational Tasks for Each Report Type

segment.source: The following table shows which tasks can be performed for each report type.
segment.target: The following table shows which tasks can be performed for each report type.

segment.source: You can rate the compatibility of your applications, installation packages, or websites, based on whether they run successfully on a 32-bit or 64-bit operating system.
segment.target: You can rate the compatibility of your applications, installation packages, or websites, based on whether they run successfully on a 32-bit or 64-bit operating system.

segment.source: Your rating applies to your entire organization and is based on your own testing results and organizational requirements.
segment.target: Your rating applies to your entire organization and is based on your own testing results and organizational requirements.

segment.source: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), you can track the deployment status of your applications and websites.
segment.target: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), you can track the deployment status of your applications and websites.

segment.source: To customize and filter your compatibility reports, you can create categories and subcategories to assign to your applications, computers, devices, and websites.
segment.target: To customize and filter your compatibility reports, you can create categories and subcategories to assign to your applications, computers, devices, and websites.

segment.source: By default, Microsoft provides the following categories:
segment.target: By default, Microsoft provides the following categories:

segment.source: You can prioritize your applications, websites, computers, and devices to help customize and filter your compatibility reports.
segment.target: You can prioritize your applications, websites, computers, and devices to help customize and filter your compatibility reports.

segment.source: Selecting the Send and Receive Status for an Application
segment.target: Selecting the Send and Receive Status for an Application

segment.source: For each application listed in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), you can select whether to send and receive specific application data through the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange
segment.target: For each application listed in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), you can select whether to send and receive specific application data through the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange

segment.source: Creating and Editing Issues and Solutions
segment.target: Creating and Editing Issues and Solutions

segment.source: This section provides step-by-step instructions for adding and editing application compatibility issues and solutions.
segment.target: This section provides step-by-step instructions for adding and editing application compatibility issues and solutions.

segment.source: Your issue and solution data can be uploaded to Microsoft through the Microsoft® Compatibility Exchange.
segment.target: Your issue and solution data can be uploaded to Microsoft through the Microsoft® Compatibility Exchange.
